title: Message
content: Simple component to display inline container with colored messages depending on given severity.

title: Button
content: A button is an interface element that allows the user to perform a specific action when clicked.

title: Icon Material
content: Simple component to display an icon from material-symbols-outlined font.

title: Icon Material
content: Refer to the material-symbols-outlined font for the list of available icons.https://fonts.google.com/icons

title: Icon Material
content: In order to use this component in your application, you must follow these steps:

title: Icon Material
content: Insert the following script in your index.html or angular.json file.

title: Icon Material
content: Simply add this selector to your style.scss file. Adapt this settings to match desired styling. Check https://fonts.google.com/icons options for more information.

title: Icon Material
content: You can now start importing this component in your application !

title: Icon
content: Simple component to display an icon as SVG tag from an svg file located in your assets/icons folder.

title: Icon
content: In order to use this component in your application, you must follow these steps:

title: Icon
content: In this folder, you can add all SVG required for your UI. You can also creates sub-folders but be aware, you'll need to format name as folderName/fileName.

title: Icon
content: Note: With this component, you can control the fill of the SVG by adding some color of the component (works by inheritance).

title: Icon
content: This service helps working with files in general but this component requires getSVG() method. Simply copy paste this service or get isolated method.

title: Icon
content: You can now start importing this component in your application !

title: Icon
content: Ensure that the SVG files in the assets/icons folder are properly named and formatted.The name input should match the file name of the SVG without the .svg extension.

title: Icon
content: By following these guidelines, you can effectively use the lib-icon component in your Angular application.

title: Welcome
content: Angular library of components, services & patterns easing development of user interfaces. This is not a framework, nor a cdk, nut simply a collection of components following best practices in angular web development.

title: Welcome
content: This repository was created as a model for creating actual application. Feel free to use take any components you want 🙌
